Key Match Events: England lost 15 wickets for 95 runs in two formats and two continents
West Indies won by nine wickets with 17 balls remaining
Post-Match Reflections: Kieron Pollard: 'Tough times don't last, tough people do'
Liam Dawson: 'We’ll have to learn, hopefully take our time a little bit more and put a score on the board'
Miscellaneous Highlights: England fans made up the overwhelming majority of the crowd in Bridgetown
Sheldon Cottrell executed his familiar march-and-salute celebration after Jason Roy completely missed a full toss
Others: West Indies, bowled out for 55 when the teams met in Dubai at the Twenty20 World Cup last October and in the doldrums ever since
England needed early wickets to have any hope of conjuring an unlikely victory, and got none
Brandon King in particular hit some splendid shots – a huge slog sweep off Rashid and a crisp cut off Tymal Mills stood out
